description.narrative: In Shan State, the project aims to improve the availability of contraceptive supplies, by providing necessary technical, coordination and financial support to address the shortage of injectables and implants. We propose to aggregate and examine data on contraceptive supplies from at least 20 townships in southern Shan State to analyze where the systems are failing. We will consult with partners working on commodities nationally to execute constructive solutions for solving immediate problems and to improve next year’s supplies and distribution systems to avoid recurring stockouts. At the national level, we will organize a consultative meeting with the MoH in Naypyitaw after January 2016 when the new government is in place, to ensure that FP2020 remains strong on the Ministry’s agenda. Based on input from key stakeholders, we would work on policy briefs linking FP2020 with the SDGs, or translate materials into Myanmar language for state and township level advocacy. Pathfinder will continue to coordinate with FP champions within the MoH and our colleagues at UNFPA.

Work with Shan State government to improve contraceptive commodities logistics management
Hold a consultative meeting at MoH after national elections in order to take stock of FP2020 plans
Support one-time translations, printing and dissemination of critical FP technical documents

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
